dataset.title: Cougar and coyote GPS telemetry, Utah/Idaho USA (OBIS-ENV-DATA example)

metadataProvider.organizationName: Max Planck Institute of Animal Behavior

abstract.para: Telemetry data from on-animal sensors deployed on a coyote in Utah in 2004-2005 and a cougar in Idaho in 2014. GPS locations for the coyote were recorded during two separate deployments, 1 in summer and 1 in winter. The collar deployed on the cougar recorded GPS locations, temperature, and standard GPS quality attributes on the same fix schedule, and activity (2-d accelerometer) on a different fix schedule. This dataset represents a part of the dataset published in the Movebank Data Repository (http://dx.doi.org/10.5441/001/1.7d8301h2), reformatted here according to the OBIS-ENV-DATA format as a test use case for tracking data. Captures, recoveries, deployments and non-location measurements are stored as events; times and locations of captures, recoveries, and location fixes are stored as occurrences; and measured values of GPS quality attributes, acceleration, and temperature are stored in ExtendedMeasurementOrFact.

intellectualRights.para: This dataset should be used to evaluate potential for animal on-animal sensor data, in particular data stored in Movebank (movebank.org), to be described in the OBIS-ENV-DATA format. For use of the actual dataset please refer to the complete published dataset (http://dx.doi.org/10.5441/001/1.7d8301h2).

To the extent possible under law, the publisher has waived all rights to these data and has dedicated them to the Public Domain (CC0 1.0). Users may copy, modify, distribute and use the work, including for commercial purposes, without restriction.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Geographic coverage includes Monroe Mountain, Fishlake National Forest, southern Utah (puma) and southern Idaho (coyote).

contact.organizationName: Max Planck Institute of Animal Behavior

gbif.citation: Mahoney PJ, Young JK (2016) Uncovering behavioural states from animal activity and site fidelity patterns. Methods in Ecology and Evolution 8(2): 174–183. https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.12658

Mahoney PJ, Ebinger M, Jaeger M, Shivik JA, Young JK (2017) Data from: Uncovering behavioural states from animal activity and site fidelity patterns. Movebank Data Repository. https://doi.org/10.5441/001/1.7d8301h2
